DDMLiterals.WashCavity_OpStatusBulkDispense1Level.Sm: Low level indicates that the contents of the dispenser should be refilled soon.
DDMLiterals.WashCavity_OpStatusBulkDispense2Level.Sm: Low level indicates that the contents of the dispenser should be refilled soon.
DDMLiterals.WashCavity_CycleStatusCleanReminder.Smar: Indicates when it's time to run a Clean Washer with affresh® cycle.
DDMLiterals.WashCavity_OpStatusBulkDispense1Level.En: Load & Go™ Dispenser 1 is running low. Refill it soon or disable it to add detergent to the drum directly
Your Load & Go™ Dispenser 1 level is currently good. When your dispenser has run out, you will need to refill it or disable it to add detergent to the drum directly.
DDMLiterals.WashCavity_OpStatusBulkDispense2Level.En: Load & Go™ Dispenser 2 is running low. Refill it soon or disable it to add detergent to the drum directly
Your Load & Go™ Dispenser 2 level is currently good. When your dispenser has run out, you will need to refill it or disable it to add detergent to the drum directly.
DDMLiterals.WashCavity_CycleStatusCleanReminder.Desc: Clean periodically to prevent odors. Select 'Clean Washer' cycle below.

F0,E1.Name: Load detected
F0,E1.Description: Load detected inside washer. Clean washer cannot be run with a load.
StepsToRepair: Please remove load and restart cycle.
If problem persists call for service. Service code: F0E1

F0,E2.Name: Over suds detected
F0,E2.Description: Looks like there are too many suds in the washer. You may experience longer cycle times as the washer tries to clear the soap.
StepsToRepair: Suds reduction routine running. Allow washer to continue. Use only HE detergent.
If problem persists call for service. Service code: F0E2

F0,E5.Name: Off balance load detected
F0,E5.Description: Looks like there's an unbalanced load in the washer. You may experience longer cycle times as the washer tries to correct for this.
StepsToRepair: Load unbalanced or too large. See “Cycle Guide” and “Using Your Washer”.
If problem persists call for service. Service code: F0E5.

F1,E1.Name: ACU Memory corruption or Hardware failure
F1,E1.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with washer. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists for service. Service code: F1E1. ACU failure.

F1,E2.Name: MCU Memory corruption or Hardware failure
F1,E2.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with washer. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists for service. Service code: F1E2. ACU (MCU) failure.

F3,E1.Name: APS out of range, unplugged or shoted
F3,E1.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with washer. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists call for service. Service code: F3E1 Analog Pressure Failure

F3,E2.Name: Wash NTC short Circuit fault
F3,E2.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with washer. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists call for service. Service code: F3E2 Wash NTC Failure

F3,E5.Name: Dry NTC open circuit fault
F3,E5.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with washer. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists call for service. Service code: F3E5 Dry NTC Failure

F3,E6.Name: Accelerometer failed self test
F3,E6.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with washer. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists call for service. Service code: F3E6 Accelerometer Failure

F4,E1.Name: Wash heater relay short error
F4,E1.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with washer. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists call for service. Service code: F4E1 Heater Relay Failure

F4,E4.Name: Dry Fan Triac Open Circuit Fault
F4,E4.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with washer. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists call for service. Service code: F4E4 Fan Failure

F5,E1.Name: Door switch open when locked
F5,E1.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with door lock. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists, call for service. Service code: F5E1 Door Switch failure

F5,E2.Name: Door cannot be locked
F5,E2.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with door lock. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists, call for service. Service code: F5E2 Door cannnot be locked

F5,E3.Name: Door cannot unlocked
F5,E3.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with door lock. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists, call for service. Service code: F5E3 Door Lock cannot be unlocked

F5,E4.Name: Door not open during consecutive cycles
F5,E4.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Door not open between cycles, please open and close the door before re-starting the cycle.
If problem persists, call for service.  Service Code F5E4 Door not open between consecutive cycles

F6,E1.Name: Communications problem between ACU and MCU
F6,E1.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with washer. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists call for service. Service code: F6E1 Communication lost with MCU

F6,E2.Name: Communication missing from ACU to HMI
F6,E2.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with washer. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists call for service. Service code: F6E2 Communication lost with ACU

F6,E3.Name: Communication missing from HMI to ACU
F6,E3.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with washer. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists call for service. Service code: F6E3 Communication lost with HMI

F7,E2.Name: Motor control over temperature
F7,E2.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with washer. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists call for service. Service code: F7E2 Motor Control Over Temperature

F7,E8.Name: Motor over temperature detected
F7,E8.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with washer. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists call for service. Service code: F7E8 Motor Temperature Max

F7,E9.Name: Locked Rotor
F7,E9.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with washer. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists call for service. Verify there is no object obstructing basket movement. Service code: F7E9 Locked Rotor

F7,EA.Name: Lost phase
F7,EA.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with washer. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists call for service.. Service code: F7EA Lost Phase

F7,EC.Name: Overload
F7,EC.Description: Looks like there's an error that requires a washer reboot.
StepsToRepair: Problem detected with washer. If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
Verify there is no object obstructing basket movement or load is too large.
If problem persists call for service. Service code: F7EC Overload

F8,E1.Name: Long Fill
F8,E1.Description: Looks like the washer is taking too long to fill or will not fill and has cancelled the cycle.
StepsToRepair: No water detected. Be sure home water supply is turned on.
Check for kinks in water supply hose.
If problem persists, call for service. Service code: F8E1.

F8,E3.Name: Overflow detection
F8,E3.Description: Water inlet valve leaking internally. Schedule service. Service code: F8E3
StepsToRepair: Water inlet valve leaking internally. Schedule service. Service code: F8E3

F9,E1.Name: Cannot take water out of the system when Drain Pump is on
F9,E1.Description: Make sure bellow drain holes and standpipe are clear. If problem persists, call for service. Service code: F9E1.
StepsToRepair: Long drain time. Check drain pump filter.
Make sure bellow drain holes and standpipe are clear.
If problem persists, call for service. Service code: F9E1.

NestSettings.NestHome.Name: Nest™ Home 1
NestSettings.HomeCombo.Name: Home All-In-One
NestSettings.WrinkleShield.Name: Wrinkle Shield™
NestSettings.WrinkleShield.Description: If your All-In-One is running a combo or dry only cycle while Nest® detects you are Away the Wrinkle Shield™ option will start after the dry cycle is complete.  Nest Away signal may take up to two hours.
NestSettings.QuietWhileHome.Name: Quiet While Home
NestSettings.QuietWhileHome.Description: Your All-In-One will automatically go into quiet mode when your nest is set to Home.
NestSettings.FanFresh.Name: Fresh While Away
NestSettings.FanFresh.Description: If your All-In-One is running a wash only cycle while Nest® detects you are Away the FanFresh® option will start after the wash cycle is complete.  Nest Away signal may take up to two hours.
NestSettings.SmartEnergy.Name: Smart Energy
NestSettings.SmartEnergy.Description: If enabled by your energy provider, the All-In-One will set an automatic delay start so that your appliance will not run during peak energy hours.

SpecialtyCycles.Activewear.Name: Activewear
SpecialtyCycles.Activewear.Description: A cycle designed for activewear that uses warm temperatures and extra fast spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.Activewear.LongDescription: A cycle designed for activewear that uses warm temperatures and extra fast spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.Jeans.Name: Jeans
SpecialtyCycles.Jeans.Description: A cycle designed for jeans that uses warm temperatures and extra fast spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.Jeans.LongDescription: A cycle designed for jeans that uses warm temperatures and extra fast spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.Swimwear.Name: Swimwear
SpecialtyCycles.Swimwear.Description: A cycle designed for swimwear that uses cold temperatures and medium spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.Swimwear.LongDescription: A cycle designed for swimwear that uses cold temperatures and medium spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.SleepingBags.Name: Sleeping Bags
SpecialtyCycles.SleepingBags.Description: A cycle designed for sleeping bags that uses warm temperatures and medium spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.SleepingBags.LongDescription: A cycle designed for sleeping bags that uses warm temperatures and medium spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.BusinessCasual.Name: Business Casual
SpecialtyCycles.BusinessCasual.Description: A cycle designed for business casual items like shirts and blouses that uses cool temperatures and fast spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.BusinessCasual.LongDescription: A cycle designed for business casual items like shirts and blouses that uses cool temperatures and fast spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.Comforters.Name: Comforters
SpecialtyCycles.Comforters.Description: A cycle designed for bulky items like comforters and jackets that uses warm temperatures and medium spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.Comforters.LongDescription: A cycle designed for bulky items like comforters and jackets that uses warm temperatures and medium spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.Blankets.Name: Blankets
SpecialtyCycles.Blankets.Description: A cycle designed for blankets that uses hot temperatures and extra fast spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.Blankets.LongDescription: A cycle designed for blankets that uses hot temperatures and extra fast spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.CoatsJackets.Name: Coats/Jackets
SpecialtyCycles.CoatsJackets.Description: A cycle that uses cold temperatures & fast spin speeds to wash coats & jackets.
SpecialtyCycles.CoatsJackets.LongDescription: A cycle designed for coats and jackets that uses cold temperatures and fast spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.Lingerie.Name: Delicate Underwear
SpecialtyCycles.Lingerie.Description: A cycle designed for delicate underwear that uses cool temperatures and slow spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.Lingerie.LongDescription: A cycle designed for delicate underwear that uses cool temperatures and slow spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.MachineWashCurtains.Name: Machine Wash Curtains
SpecialtyCycles.MachineWashCurtains.Description: A cycle designed for machine wash curtains that uses cold temperatures and medium spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.MachineWashCurtains.LongDescription: A cycle designed for machine wash curtains that uses cold temperatures and medium spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.Diapers.Name: Cloth Diapers
SpecialtyCycles.Diapers.Description: A cycle designed for cloth diapers that uses extra hot temperatures and extra fast spin speeds.
SpecialtyCycles.Diapers.LongDescription: A cycle designed for cloth diapers that uses extra hot temperatures and extra fast spin speeds.

DetergentDispenser.Name: Detergent Dispenser
DetergentDispenser.Description: Turns automatic dosing on and off

DetergentConcentration.Name: Detergent Concentration
DetergentConcentration.Description: Allow user to adjust the concentration level of detergent they are using

Status.Name: Status
Status.Description: This button launches a picker allowing the user to select Active or Inactive, effectively turning dispensing on/off

Content.Name: Content
Content.Description: This button launches a picker allowing the user to change the chamber between Detergent and Softener

QuiteMode.Name: Quite Mode
QuiteMode.Description: Toggles quiet mode on and off.

ControlLock.Name: Control Lock
ControlLock.Description: Toggles the control lock feature on and off. Control lock toggle is disabled and inactive when appliance is running.

DryOnly.Name: Dry Only
DryOnly.Description: Allows you to skip the wash cycle.

WashDryTransition.Name: Washing Complete
WashDryTransition.Description: When running wash+dry cycle, provide a notification when wash cycle is complete. Inform consumer that unit is moving into drying phase and they have the ability to pause the cycle.

Party.Name: Party Mode
Party.Description: Party Mode is designed to perform function that helps service high volume consumption. Party Mode will keep the oven warning and the freezer producing more ice,perfect for hosting a party.

Quiet.Name: Quiet Mode
Quiet.Description: Quiet Mode Minimizes the appliances operating noise and mutes alert sounds.

Control.Name: Control Lock
Control.Description: Control Lock status of the control panel to prevent unintended use of the participating appliances.

Vacation.Name: Vacation Mode
Vacation.Description: Vacation Mode monitors use of your appliances while you're away.

MachineCleaningWipes.Name: affresh® Machine Cleaning Wipes
MachineCleaningWipes.Description: Keeping your washer looking like new is easy, thanks to the versatility of affresh® Machine Cleaning Wipes—the strongest and thickest washing machine cleaning wipe available. Featuring dual-sided durability, a clean lemongrass scent and Micro-Grab™ fibers that visibly lift and lock in residue, dirt and dust from machine surfaces, no other washing machine wipe cleans better.
MachineCleaningWipes.Disclaimer: Keeping your washer looking like new is easy, thanks to the versatility of affresh® Machine Cleaning Wipes—the strongest and thickest washing machine cleaning wipe available. Featuring dual-sided durability, a clean lemongrass scent and Micro-Grab™ fibers that visibly lift and lock in residue, dirt and dust from machine surfaces, no other washing machine wipe cleans better.

MachineCleanerTablets6count.Name: affresh® Washing Machine Cleaner Tablets – 6 count
MachineCleanerTablets6count.Description: Did you know that without proper care, your washing machine may need a wash of its own? That’s why each affresh® Washing Machine Cleaner tablet is specially formulated to help reduce odor-causing residues and grime and keep your washing machine performing and looking like new. Simply drop a tablet in for a clean with confidence.
MachineCleanerTablets6count.Disclaimer: Did you know that without proper care, your washing machine may need a wash of its own? That’s why each affresh® Washing Machine Cleaner tablet is specially formulated to help reduce odor-causing residues and grime and keep your washing machine performing and looking like new. Simply drop a tablet in for a clean with confidence.

SmartTip.Title: Care Tip
SmartTip.Content: Keep wrinkles from setting into clean, dry fabrics. The Wrinkle Shield™ Plus option with Steam uses tumbling and steam for up to 140 minutes after the cycle ends (depending on your model) or until you open the door, to guard against wrinkles.

SmartTip.Title: Care Tip
SmartTip.Content: The Sanitize cycle with heater uses increased water temperature to eliminate 99.9% of common household bacteria. Bacteria tested were S. aureua, P. aeruginosa, and K. pneumoniae.

SmartTip.Title: Care Tip
SmartTip.Content: Keep clothes fresh for up to 12 hours after the wash cycle has ended with FanFresh®. A built-in fan activates after the wash cycle is over, tumbling clothes for up to 12 hours so you can finish laundry when you're ready.

SmartTip.Title: Care Tip
SmartTip.Content: Wash loads faster with the Quick Wash cycle that cuts down on wash and spin time to shorten the cycle.
